I Present To You
My Short Poem :

ðŸ’§ DROP ðŸ©¸

ðŸ“œ
ðŸ’§ DROP ðŸ©¸

The moment when I opened my eyes
from the nap I took
not too long agoâ€¦
I saw the burning rose like red meteor
those were once the sparkling wish granting stars.
That day the sun went down but moon never showed up.
the burden of the talent I wore,
buried me in my hopeless grave.

I was stuck.
I was stuck in nothingness of the starry night
waiting for return of the light.
I saw a spark, a faint one.
I ran towards it, But I was too late.
It was already gone.
I felt like I shouldn't have run this far.
probably should've just stayed at home,
feasting on cookies from the jar.
I was lost, forgotten my way back home

But instead of sad,
the realization of being lost made me happy.
I perceived being lost as being free.
Free from the undeniable promises and
unwritten rules.
No compromises, No expectations,
Running, flying and
wandering in Strange lands.
But, I slipped and injured myself.
I never understood the same rope
stopping me from flying
was the one keeping me at my place.
Suddenly the bright light emerged from the horizon, I saw.
It was like the warm lime-orange blanket across the sky,
lit from both sides

And I,
was the Kite drowning in high tides
I smiled as I drown into the darkness of the ocean.
with green colour light blocking my vision and my motion.
Then, suddenly I woke up
from the nap I took not
too long ago.
But sun didn't.
